I read online that Kim, the CEO of the CS company, achieved great success because he was different from others. Kim, using this expertise, transformed his company one of the most profitable software enterprises in Korea. When he was high school student, he did not study to go to university like other students in Korea. He did not go to university, but made programs on and on. As a result, he made a great program and earned prestige. This example clearly shows that it is better to be different from others because of expertise.

To summarize, I believe that being different from others is helpful for achieving success on the grounds that people can save money and also people can get expertise.

column1: What are some important qualities of a good supervisor(boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3:
There are some crucial aspects to become a good supervisor. I strongly believe that someone who wants to be a great boss should have diligence, confidence and warm heart. These three traits are the most necessary components for a good supervisor.
 
To begin with, diligence is the most significant thing among many other qualities because there would be no success if someone is very lazy. There is a proverb that "Early bird catches bugs". Likewise, it is the most fundamental quality for supervisor who manages many people under his or her hand. If a company have an idle boss, it would ruin very quickly. For example, there was a chairman of some company, he always drank every night and did not care any tasks of the company. Eventually, he got fired because his subordinates completely hated him.
 
Also, confidence is substantial trait of a good supervisor's requirement. Generally, a supervisor manages a lot of subordinates under his feet. To lead many people's opinion, the leader should have great leadership that never sway by other assertions. If he would not decide his will or would not gather other people's diverse arguments, the company's policy would face a lot of problems. For instance, when I was a chairman of the committee at my work, I did not make a crucial decision due to some subordinate's opposition. However, that hesitation resulted in a bigger confusion.
 
In addition, a warm-hearted mind is needed to someone who would like to be a great supervisor. This characteristic can obtain much better respect from subordinates. In all likelihood, no one would not like the supervisor who has a nice manner and is very kind. It is said that someone gives a goodwill to others, he will return it as much as he was given. Therefore, if someone utterly wants to be a great boss, he should have a thoughtful mind to others.

To conclude, there are some indispensable elements to be a good advisor. they are diligence, confidence and warm heart. If someone has these traits already, he would be a truly fine supervisor.

column1: The best way to relax and reduce stress is by spending some time alone.
column3:
As to the statement that the most appropriate methods to relieve stress is to have personal time, I strongly agree with it. That’s because it is more easier to enjoy free time and there are lots of recreations that one person can enjoy.

First, If people have a pastime alone, they do not need to be careful about other things. Specifically, playing with friends require to arrange meeting time, places and what they will do. This is possible to cause additional stress for an individual because it is time-consuming and hard to reconcile the options. For example, I have always loved to go hiking in mountains, and if I go there with someone, I would feel uncomfortable since I should consider the routes and how much we will walk. However, when I go hiking alone, I don’t need to worry about specific plans. I am able to choose courses to which I am attracted. In this regard, I believe that spending leisure time alone allows people to enjoy more easily.

Second, nowadays, people don't need to find friends purposely to be recharged. It was fairly common for people in the past to have their free time with others, as going to beach or playing group sports. On the other hand, in today’s society, there are numerous entertainment every person can enjoy without gathering other people. For example, my father used to play soccer after school because it is hard to find a variety of pleasures in his town. He virtually did not have choice but to play physical activities. In contrast, in modern society, people have made various pastimes such as computer games, watching shows and doing something through smart phones. These are sometimes more interesting and don't require other person. This is why I don't think that group activities is necessary to relieve stress.

To sum up, enjoying pastimes alone is more better in some ways because people can arrange their time comfortably and there are many enjoyments that only a single person can enjoy.

column1: It is more enjoyable to have a job where you work only three days a week for long hours than to have a job where you work five days a week for shorter hours.
column3:
Some people might say that working five days a week for short hours is preferred because they can work with strong but short concentration. However, in my opinion, working three days a week for long hours is better for following reasons: We can relieve our stress by enjoying a hobby or having a journey.
 
For the primary reason, people can enjoy their hobby with enough time. Enjoying own hobby has an influence on psychological happiness. Thus, having a hobby is the best for spending holidays. However, there are things to do during holidays such as home chores, meeting friends. It is not easy to make time for enjoying own hobby. For example, in my country, people generally work for five days a week. It is rare to find people who enjoy their hobby within the two other days because most of the people think these holidays fly easily, just for taking a rest or having time with their family. Of course some might say working five days a week for short hours can use their after-working time, which is relatively longer than working three days a week, but it is not easy to manage after-working time as they think due to getting tired. Enjoying own hobby has an influence on psychological happiness Therefore, I prefer to working three days a week for long hours.
 
My next reason for supporting working three days a week for long hours is because workers can go travel during their holidays. Travel allows people not only to stress out, but also to increase productivity. To be specific, through travelling, people can enjoy their life at a distance. Seeing a wonderful landscape and eating a delicious food will give a sound body with a sound mind. They will be ready for getting back to work place with good condition. Good condition will bring a strong passion and enthusiasm. They will work hard even they have to work for long hours, and this will affect their future promotion. Following this repertory, people will be full of positive mind and praise their life. This is my reason why working three days a week is good.
 
To sum up, working three days a week for long hours is better option than the other because this option enables workers to manage their time easily. Making/enjoying a hobby or going travel really works for stress-out and this allows people to fall in love with their happy life, even their jobs.

column1:
Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
Movies and television have more negative effects than possible positive effects on young people.
column3:
Some people argue that watching televised programs on TV would have positive effects on youth because it enables them to experience the world indirectly so that it is educational. However, I am of believer of the opposite is true. To elaborate, TV programs nowadays contain inappropriate contents and it is addictive in a way that it prevents the young to have healthier activities outdoor.
 
To begin with, visual images on TV in recent years display quite violent and inappropriate images for the youth to watch. The problem here is that these images will have negative effect on teenagers and adolescents because their mind is not as concrete as those of adults and they are vulnerable to these images in a way that it will affect their future behavior. To illustrate, one research done by Seoul National University of South Korea, those teenagers who watched violent images such as gunshots or fistfights showed 80% higher tendency to display violent act than those who did not. Therefore, TV programs today which depict much of these images will have definite negative effect on the youth.
 
Another equally important reason is that watching TV can be addictive so that it prevents teenagers to have healthier outdoor activities. TV programs are becoming bolder and bolder in its way of expression to attract more viewers. That is, they try to capture people’s eyes constantly to keep them in front of TV. Such despicable effort will lure young people to watch TV for all day long, resulting in unhealthy habit sitting face-to-face with TV screen every day. Such habit would eventually lead to reduction of physical health and solitary life style.
 
In conclusion, I believe watching TV programs for teenagers only brings negative results, because TV programs illustrate unhealthy images for the young and it lures vulnerable mind of teens to stare at the screen all day. In this regard, it is imperative to say that advantage of watching TV outweighs disadvantages.

column1:
Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
Young people enjoy life more than older people.
column3:
Some argue that when people get older, there would not be many excitements and leisure activities to enjoy as much as when they are younger. However, in my opinion, elderly would have their own time of their lives and enjoy much as they did when they were young. That is, older people spend their leisure time in different way than younger people. Moreover, they are much more satisfied and experienced than the young so they know how to please themselves.
 
To begin with, the elders spend their leisure time different from the young people have good times. To elaborate, the youth would spend their time pursuing excitements such as drinking, clubbing, or active sports such as football, tennis or soccer. In contrary, older people pursue peaceful and relaxing leisure such as reading in café, playing poker games, or just a simple walk during on a warm day. Such activities are enough for the old people to enjoy. For example, when I went to Bali, Indonesia, there were many retired elderly who visited. They were having time of their lives enjoying beach walk, having good conversation in cafes, and reading while sunbathing. In this regard, I do not think that the young will have more fun than the old.
 
On top of that, since old people are more experienced and satisfied, they can enjoy more comfortably. To illustrate, most of the elderly underwent many things so they know what they want. They probably tried many leisure activities and know exactly which activities they themselves enjoy or not. Therefore, there is no waste of time or money to discover which is good for them. Moreover, most of them have already achieved their goal or dream, so they are more satisfied with their life than the young. As their satisfaction level is higher than the youth, they will spend their extra time much happier.
 
To wrap up, I am a strong believer of old people enjoy life as much as young people do. Since the old people are more experience and knows what they want in addition to the fact that they are much more satisfied with their lives, and they have different way of relaxing and enjoy from the young, it is wrong to say the young have better way of enjoying life.

column1: In twenty years there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.
column3:
Along with the development of technology, many people have their own cars compared to the past twenty years. Then, what would happen in next twenty years? While some assert that in the future there will be fewer cars in use than are today, others argue in the opposite perspective opinion. Personally, the latter opinion seems much more persuasive for development of cars and economical reasons. 

To begin with, in twenty years, every person can buy the cars because of their cheap prices. This is primarily due to the fact that development of alternative energy such as hydrogen, sunshine power and water. To be specific, these new cheap energy will replace expensive fossil fuel energy. Actually, the cost of using car is highly expensive because of the continually increasing cost of fuel; therefore, cheaper fuel would lead to increasing consumption of cars. A research on fuel was carried out at Seoul University. According to the study, 78 percent of 20s people would buy their future cars if the fuel is cheaper. This result clearly shows that in twenty years many people will afford to buy their cars.

Secondly, car is the most convenient transportation and it will be same in twenty years either. To illustrate further, although developed technology made airplanes, we do not use airplane in our daily lives. This shows that driving car is the best for our routine lives. In twenty years, there might be a new fascinating transportation; however, using car will be the most suitable method to go near places. For example, most people use their car when they go other places, especially in Korea. According to the study of Korean University, 89 of people responded to use their car among 7 transportations and they said that it is because car is the most convenient and comfortable for them. The research demonstrates that most of people feel comfortable regarding cars.

In conclusion, even in twenty years, there will be more cars in use than today. This is because the price of using car will be decreased and the car is the most convenient transportation for people.

column1: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? High school students should be allowed to choose some of their classes.
column3:
Some argue that it is better for high school students to study fixed curriculum because it will teach them necessary education, therefore better prepared for college. However, I am of a believer the opposite is true. Having to choose courses offer students to figure out what their real interests are. Moreover, it is much more effective in terms of learning, because they feel more responsibility.

First of all, giving freedom for high school students to choose some of their classes will provide them opportunity to find out what they are really interested in. To elaborate, since students are not fully aware of their true academic pursuits, having choices what to study will provide them to get a taste of many fields so that they can find the particular study that they want to go deeper. A research done by Department of Education of Korea, students who went to school where students had some freedom of choosing course had 40% better academic achievement compared to students who went to the school where had fixed curriculum all along. The department concluded that the reason for this better academic achievement was students who had choices what to learn during high school realized their career goal earlier than those who had not. Looking at this research result, it is obvious that it is better for high school students to have some extent of freedom to choose their classes.

Moreover, it is much effective way of learning because students would feel responsible to their choices. Since they chose their courses by themselves, they will have much more responsibility to be good at it than studying what they are given. Therefore, they will put more effort on the class. For example, I exerted bigger effort to the classes that I chose than the one that was fixed during my high school years because I wanted to be responsible to my choice.

In conclusion, it is clear that advantages of choosing some classes for high school student outweigh the disadvantages.

column1: Teachers should not make their social and political views known to students in the classroom.
column3:
As to the statement that teachers could express their own opinion in regard to  certain social or political events, in my views, it has some problems and teachers should avoid showing their personal thoughts about these things. There are two reasons: students are so young and susceptible to a teacher’s words that students can have biased view and imparting specific knowledge is educator’s primary duty.
  
First, teacher’s remarks about sensitive issues are very influential to their students, so they would be likely to grow concept that is similar to their teacher’s idea. It is evident that if one teacher supports one particular party or one-sided position, it definitely leads students to take a stance analogous to teacher’s thoughts. For example, according to research by the Korea University, in the test, researchers set two divided classes. One teacher explained the Iraq War as a way to attain world peace, while the other one portrayed the war caused by the invasion of the US to obtain Oil. Surprisingly, after each teacher finished their descriptions, students followed the positive or native view against the war at high rates. It demonstrated that how partial and biased view can be made by teachers’ own perspective.

Second, not only does it disrupt students to cultivate impartial view related to political and social events, in term of a teacher’s duty, it also can not be allowed to let students know what the teacher’s view is. That is, most students come to school to learn specific knowledge so that they are able to prepare easily to pursue a future career or to enter into top universities. However, if teachers focus on imparting ambiguous ones, which contain political perspective, some of students would regard it as a waste of time because it may not be helpful to prepare their crucial exams. This is true that students are require to grow their own view about social affairs since they are also one of the members in society, but I am convinced that it is not the teacher’s job.

In summary, if possible, teachers have to avoid showing their personal perspective toward sensitive subjects like political or social affairs. This is because students are highly influential to teacher’s words and because teachers should concentrate on giving practical learning.

column1: Should government support athletics like an Olympic team or should they support art, such as museum and exhibit?
column3:
At the time that countries were having war with each others, it was mandatory for them to expand their territories and colonize other country in order to expedite their strides. Furthermore, indoctrinating their cultures or languages to country that they successfully colonized is essential works because of forestalling the rebellions of colonized country. However, we are living in peaceful and cohesive society nowadays, so most of countries are competing with each other by showing their athletic skill or their unique style of art. If government should support one between them, they should endorse the arts rather than supporting the athletics. Supporting arts is not only teaching lesson about history and culture, but also it could promote the tourism.
 
 First and foremost, tourism is crucial task for countries to show their traditions and efficient way to afford the money. Furthermore, arts could enhance the tourism by showing the greatest work from famous painter or writer from the past, so it could expedite the stride of countries’ economy. Italy and England is perfect example of this case. Almost million people are dropping by these countries in order to appreciate or see the works of Leonardo da Vinci or William Turner etc. Furthermore, the visitor often purchases the monument of hallmark of the region. Throughout this process, countries are earning tremendous of money unless these greatest works are stolen by thief. The government can facilitate the money that they obtain from tourism by augmenting more public infrastructure or ameliorating the service of tourism. 
 
 Most of art pieces reflect the life style of people in era that they involved and the tradition that people possess. For example, if one country suffered from colonizing of other country, the art works of colonized country would mostly show the dark or gloomy atmosphere, and sometime show their tradition stealthily. In contrast, the artworks from well-developed country could display the elegance and grace side atmosphere. When Korea was colonized by Japan, many ceramists were kidnapped and compellingly went to Japan in order to teach the techniques of making Korean ceramic. After Japan took a advantage of Korean ceramist, they killed the ceramist mercilessly. Therefore, the ceramic from colonized period show erratic and blunting surface, and most of them engraved Korean traditional painting.

In conclusion, arts is not only shows the tradition and culture of country, but also it could provide the many beneficial aspect. Therefore, government should spend money on preserving their art work, and people should be proud of what our ancestor leave.

column1: Government should pay attention to health care /not environmental problem
column3:
Many people argue that government should pay more attention to health care because keeping people healthy is more important than maintaining clean environment. Nonetheless, I strongly suggest that government put environmental problems before health care because reduced environmental problems can mean less health care burden for government and a large portion of environmental problems cannot be treated individually whereas people can individually care for their own health.
 
 First of all, if government pay more attention to environmental concerns, health problems will naturally decrease. Environmental pollution is one of the leading factors of disease nowadays. Therefore, if government increases its investment in environmental protection and enforces stricter laws, it can consequently cut its budget for health care.  For instance, if someone suffers lung cancer which is usually known to be caused by air pollution, this person will probably rely on government subsidies to receive expensive treatments. If government had paid more attention to regulating environmental pollution in the first place, government would not have had to spend a dime on this person. Consequently, government should pay more attention to environmental concerns as a long term solution to health problems. 
 
Secondly, environmental issues cannot usually be handled individually while each person can look after own health. Environmental problems are global concerns which require the initiatives of government. For example, the deforestation in Amazon is causing severe global scale problems such as global warming. However, there is a limit to what individuals can do to stop these without help of government. On the other side, health problems can be dealt individually by regularly exercising and maintaining healthy diet. There is nothing much government can do except for financially subsidizing patients. Having said all, government should prioritize environmental problems. 
 
In conclusion, government should take environmental issues more seriously than health care because reducing environmental problems can be a solution to health problems and health care can be handled individually.

column1: People who do not accept criticism from others cannot be successful at working in a group.
column3:
There has been heated debate over the issue of whether people who do not accept criticism from others cannot be successful at working in a group. While there are many good arguments for both positions, the following argument will explain in detail why I agree.
 
My first argument for the influence of people should be espoused. This is because people play critical roles in developing our untapped talents. Modern-day people live hectic lives because today's globalized society is increasingly competitive and constantly changing. Consequently, it is difficult for people to discover their personal interests and pursue the fields of study that they prefer. This makes it crucial for people to help us to develop our talents and tap into our full potential. Therefore, people' influence cannot be overlooked in this context.  According to a group of education experts at Columbia University, people who are under the close guidance of their co-workers and boss at their workplace decide on their future careers and develop their potential faster than people who are not. The majority of education experts argued that people are likely to be unproductive if they do not fully receive the advice and help of their peers and boss, especially when they are in their potential stages. 
 
Moreover, my strong support for people' influence can be rationalized. This is attributed to the fact that people, with their years of experience, can offer lessons on morality and ethics. People who are not still mentally immature have long way to go before they become experts in their fields. During this long journey, they tend to make many mistakes and are prone to misbehave. However, people can be guided by their closer friends and mates, who can teach them about etiquette and social norms and can thus become good models for society. In this respect, people exert good influence on us. For example, undeveloped people may give in to the temptation of playing computer games allnight long because they are too immature to judge right from wrong. This is why others influence is an urgent need. With the guidance of people around us  such as co-workers or boss of us, we can learn how to avoid such temptations and become law-abiding citizens, by listening to our advisers' descriptions of their own experiences. Through such lessons, we can become holistic beings.
 
In a nut shell, my discussion above presents two stronger arguments for people' influence which I believe effectively convince the reader.

column1: For success in school or work, having ability to adapt to changing conditions or circumstances is more important than having excellent knowledge of a field.
column3:
Various opinions may exist over whether having ability to adapt to changing conditions or circumstances is more important than having excellent knowledge of a field for success in school or work. As far as I am concerned, I am in complete disagreement with the argument. The two ideas can be sufficient evidence to support my disagreement.
 
My first argument for having excellent knowledge of a field for success in school or work should be espoused. This is because it helps us to be well-informed for success in school or work. While we grow up, we are exposed to certain types of the information and knowledge about the world, through education at work as well as at school. The problem with this is that most of the information and knowledge is conveyed from one source's particular viewpoint. Given this, in order to be well-informed, we try to learn about different viewpoints from information through excellent knowledge of a field. In my case, I acquired information about space exploration by taking society class at university. Due to the class, I came to be fully exposed to the great achievements of governmental space projects. However, my perspectives on these governmental space projects could not be solely positive when I knew the difficulty of exploring space and huge budgets involved through doing my class assignments. Without these excellent knowledge of a field, I might have held a slanted view of what was going around me.
 
Moreover, my strong support for broad knowledge of a field for success in school or work can be rationalized. This is attributed to the fact that it can allow us to get the latest information. Our world is evolving at a surprising speed. As a result, we may have difficulty understanding all of the changes and new events come about. Given this context, it is important that we try to keep current by learning changes and events through having excellent knowledge of a field. In a recent survey carried out by Harvard University, nearly two thirds of respondents felt that they could update their knowledge and successfully adjust themselves to the changing environments through having excellent knowledge of a field. According to the respondents, these broad knowledge prevented them from being confined to an outdated world. It is no surprise that there has recently been a drastic increase in the number of people who have excellent knowledge of a field to gain the latest knowledge of the world.
 
In conclusion, it is undeniable that people can become well-rounded and successful by having excellent knowledge of a field. By doing so, they can also avoid becoming biased and outdated for their success at work as well as in school. These two reasons both connect to our increasing need to completely succeed in school or work.

column1: University athletic departments should receive the same amount of funding as university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3:
Usually, libraries have been considered to be the yardstick judging academic width and richness of the universities. Even though facilities, systems and the amount of books in libraries have been considerably factored in by each college, athletic facilities and the importance of maintaining students' physical health were not deemed to be significant. However, now is the time that universities equally fund athletic departments and libraries, since physical health is seriously interwined with mental health as well as academic motivation, and there are many learners who learn much more effectively during/after moving their body.
 
Firstly, athletic department should be equally supported as library because funding support in athletic department can directly lead to improvement of university's diverse extracurricular activities about exercise, and athletic equipment and facility, which will greatly benefit the whole students' health. Since physical health hugely affects mental health and academic motivation, more funding for athletic departments will surely improve overall happiness and efficiency in learning. My friend was too obsessed with getting high score on the test once before, so she studied all days except for the meal time without moving her body. As a result, she sufferred from illness, as well as lost momentum in studying. Later, when she tried to regularly exercise, all the problems were solved.
 
Secondly, it is said by the pedagogists that a type of learners learn more effectively when they move their body. It is very likely that this kinesthetic type of learners are more included in athletic departments than in other majors, and this can be a just reason claiming the need to fund the athletic departments to the equal degree with libraries, since both of them are there for the same reason: to facilitate students' effective study.
 
Therefore, universities should equally fund athletic departments and library because increased funding for athletic departments will enhance general athletic facility and exercise activity which will improve overall physical and mental health, as well as academic motivation of students, and kinesthetic learners will benefit from increased funding. Just as libraries, forming supportive environment on campus for exercise and athletic activities can significantly enhance students' quality of campus life.
